channel.title: Urbana campus events in the Chicago area
channel.description: Repository for all Illinois events being held in the Chicago metropolitan areas

item.title: Roundtable - Safe, Sound, & Strategic: Approaches to Cyber Security
item.description:
Hactivists. Nation states. Organized crime. Is your company's information safe?
 
Joe Dubbs, a director in PwC's financial services cyber security consulting practice, will provide a current perspective on these threats - and others - that organizations face. We'll review the methods that attackers use, as well as the questions that you need to be asking to control the risk of cyber threats. It's the last Roundtable of the 2014 - 15 series, so make your reservation today!
 
Lunch and CPE credit provided.
 
RSVP by Tuesday, May 12th, 2015.

item.title: West Suburban Illini Club: Chicagoland Executive Peer Group
item.description: Our Vision as a Chicago area executive peer group is to provide a learning, collaboration and business leadership environment that results in great businesses, great friendships and a strong alumni base.

item.title: West Suburban Illini Club: Illini 400 "Send-off reception"
item.description: Don't miss the West Suburban Illini Club's "Send Off Reception" for the 2015 Illini 4000 ride!  Join your fellow Illini alumni at Two Brothers Roundhouse Brewery in Aurora Tuesday, May 19 from 6:00 to 8:00pm. This year's team of riders includes 30 students riding bicycles from NYC to San Fran raising funds for cancer research and patient support services.

item.title: Pints & Pac-Man: An evening at Headquarters Beercade
item.description:
Let the games begin!

Join the BYAC for a casual evening of networking, classic arcade, and pinball at Headquarters Beercade in River North. (Gaming skills optional!)  Enjoy appetizers, drinks, and all of the arcade games you can handle at this venerable establishment's River North outpost, while connecting with alumni. Check out more than 65 vintage titles, including Space Invaders, Frogger, and The Simpsons. Game on - make your reservation today!

RSVP by May 26, 2015.

item.title: Robert Marovich at DePaul University Bookstore, Chicago, IL
item.description: Robert Marovich will sign copies of A City Called Heaven: Chicago and the Birth of Gospel Music and speak at the DePaul University Bookstore.

item.title: Thomas Gradel & Dick Simpson at Printers Row Lit Fest, Chicago, IL
item.description: Thomas Gradel & Dick Simpson, co-authors of Corrupt Illinois: Patronage, Cronyism, and Criminality, will sign books at the University of Illinois Press booth at Printers Row Lit Fest.

item.title: Cynthia Clampitt at Printers Row Lit Fest, Chicago, IL
item.description: Cynthia Clampitt, author of Midwest Maize: How Corn Shaped the U.S. Heartland, will sign books at the University of Illinois Press booth at Printers Row Lit Fest.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Printers Row Lit Fest, Chicago, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will sign books In the University of Illinois Press booth at Printers Row Lit Fest.

item.title: Dick Simpson at Nigara Foundation, Chicago, IL
item.description: Dick Simpson co-author of Corrupt Illinois: Patronage, Cronyism, and Criminality will speak and sign books.

item.title: Art on the Terrace at the Museum of Contemporary Art
item.description:
Join the College of Business Alumni Association for Art on the Terrace, an evening of outdoor, live music at Chicago's Museum of Contemporary Art. Enjoy a private tour and dinner on the museum's terrace with live music or choose to enjoy dinner only.

Connect with Business alumni and enjoy a lovely summer night in Chicago!

RSVP by Sunday, June 21, 2015

item.title: Retreat for Graduate Women in Chemistry
4th Annual Fall Finale
item.description:
Join the College of Business Alumni Association and Dean's Business Council as they host the 4th Annual Fall Finale Golf Outing at Briarwood Country Club in Deerfield, Illinois.

By participating in a day of golf, games, and giveaways, you provide scholarships to a diverse pool of high-aiming students who would otherwise not be able to attend Illinois. Your generosity will also help them master the latest classroom technology, as well as graduate from one of the top-ranked business programs in the US.

The College of Business relies on private funding—not state funds. That means our students need your support more than ever. Help us drive the future of business leadership.

item.title: Looking in the right direction: Carl Woese and the New Biology
item.description:
The Carl R. Woese Institute for Genomic Biology is proud to host our symposium "Looking in the right direction: Carl Woese and the New Biology" to mark the renaming of our Institute.

The symposium will highlight not only some of the historical aspects of work on microbiology, evolution and molecular biology as researched by Carl Woese and colleagues, but also some of the most exciting modern research directions that have been inspired or impacted by his work and ideas.

The scientific program for the event will be held at the Alice Campbell Alumni Center on the campus of the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

item.title: Sonja Williams at Bronzeville Historical Society Salon, Chicago, IL
item.description: Sonja D. Williams, author of Word Warrior: Richard Durham, Radio and Freedom, will read discuss her book at the Bronzeville Historical Society Salon.

item.title: Sonja Williams at Carter G. Woodson Regional Library, Chicago, IL
item.description: Sonja D. Williams, author of Word Warrior: Richard Durham, Radio and Freedom, will read discuss her book at the Carter G. Woodson Regional Library.

item.title: Sonja Williams at Harold Washington Public Library, Chicago, IL
item.description: Sonja D. Williams, author of Word Warrior: Richard Durham, Radio and Freedom, will read discuss her book at the Harold Washington Public Library.

item.title: Sonja Williams at Roosevelt University, Chicago, IL
item.description: Sonja D. Williams, author of Word Warrior: Richard Durham, Radio and Freedom, will read discuss her book at the Drake Center at Roosevelt University.
